author: The Telegraph
title: Win up to 1,000 yuan with essays about Tibet or Xinjiang
text: More Chinese news and features at telegraph.co.uk/chinawatch Hi expats, chinadaily.com.cn is organising an essay contest and jackpot. Foreign readers are welcome to write about their personal experience in Xinjiang or Tibet, and submit questions about the two regions. Essays will be judged according to the quality of expression and content. We are looking for uplifting, moving and lively pieces. No plagiarism is allowed. At least one photo is required for each essay, which should contain 500-800 words. Videos are also welcome. Two sets of prizes are available for the winners, with essays about Tibet and essays about Xinjiang judged separately. The first-prize winners will get 1,000 yuan (one prize per region). The second-prize winners will get 500 yuan (two prizes per region). And the third-prize winners will get 200 yuan (five prizes per region). In addition to your essay, please include a question about what you would like to know more about either or both regions. Good questions will be taken into consideration when awarding the prize. If you have never been to Xinjiang or Tibet, you can still win a prize for a jackpot lottery of 500 yuan by submitting a question you have about either or both regions. All essay entries will also be entered into the jackpot. The deadline is 15 August for Tibet and 15 September for Xinjiang. Winners will be announced on 1 September for Tibet and 1 October for Xinjiang. Please send your essays and questions to chinanews@chinadaily.com.cn, or just post them at bbs.chinadaily.com.cn .
